poem:
"Ballad of the Unexpected Date"

300 characters exchanged,
A profile-picture mistaken, surely,
For a passionate iron man queen,
Pining for carp noodling in brooks unseen. 

No stenograph, no ink-stained collar.
Less lawyer, more sprite, she made me holler,
Opposite a couple adding to the ark,
My briefcase love, a blind date lark.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Blind date: ‘She would have swiped left on me on a dating app’ Mark on Abby What were you hoping for?To nick some Guardian stationery when I came into the office for my photo shoot. A fruitless pursuit, sadly. First impressions?Intelligent and less lawyery than anticipated – not even a briefcase. What did you talk about?How she does iron man competitions and her interest in carp noodling. Most awkward moment?There was a couple opposite us". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
